, also known as the East–War War and the East–West War of the Lushai Hills (1877-1889) was a conflict between the Eastern Lushai (Mizo) chiefs descended from Lalsavunga and the Western Lushai chiefs descended from Mângpawrha.
Background
The tensions began with the dispute over a marriage candidate. Chief Vanhnuailiana went to Nisapui and arranged the wedding of his son Liankhama with the daughter of a Chenkual chief named Tuali. However, Suakpuilala managed to secure Tuali for his son Kalkhama instead and got them married in haste. Vanhnuailiana was outraged and, on his deathbed, informed his sons to never forget such a shameful incident.
